READ THESE INSTRUCTIONS FIRST <|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[92, 416, 718, 432]]<|/det|> Write your Centre number, candidate number and name on all the work you hand in. <|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[92, 432, 320, 447]]<|/det|> Write in dark blue or black pen. <|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[92, 447, 504, 462]]<|/det|> You may use an HB pencil for any diagrams or graphs. <|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[92, 462, 504, 477]]<|/det|> Do not use staples, paper clips, glue or correction fluid. <|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[92, 476, 380, 491]]<|/det|> DO NOT WRITE IN ANY BARCODES. <|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[92, 502, 273, 517]]<|/det|> Answer both questions. <|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[92, 516, 780, 532]]<|/det|> You will be allowed to work with the apparatus for a maximum of one hour for each question. <|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[92, 531, 905, 560]]<|/det|> You are expected to record all your observations as soon as these observations are made, and to plan the presentation of the records so that it is not necessary to make a fair copy of them. <|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[92, 559, 740, 574]]<|/det|> You are reminded of the need for good English and clear presentation in your answers. <|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[92, 585, 358, 600]]<|/det|> Electronic calculators may be used. <|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[92, 599, 767, 615]]<|/det|> You may lose marks if you do not show your working or if you do not use appropriate units. <|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[92, 624, 806, 641]]<|/det|> Additional answer paper and graph paper should be used only if it becomes necessary to do so. <|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[92, 651, 604, 666]]<|/det|> At the end of the examination, fasten all your work securely together. <|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[92, 666, 759, 682]]<|/det|> The number of marks is given in brackets [ ] at the end of each question or part question. <|ref|>table<|/ref|><|det|>[[680, 721, 905, 850]]<|/det|>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[260, 72, 740, 89]]<|/det|>
You may not need to use all of the materials provided.

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[77, 102, 94, 121]]<|/det|>
<label>1</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[114, 102, 675, 120]]<|/det|>
In this experiment, you will investigate the motion of a wooden strip.

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[114, 133, 146, 152]]<|/det|>
<label>(a)</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[165, 133, 544, 152]]<|/det|>
• Set up the apparatus as shown in Fig. 1.1.

<|ref|>image<|/ref|><|det|>[[225, 163, 771, 528]]<|/det|>


<|ref|>image_caption<|/ref|><|det|>[[463, 546, 532, 564]]<|/det|>
<label>Fig. 1.1</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[165, 577, 185, 596]]<|/det|>
<label>•</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[193, 577, 920, 612]]<|/det|>
The longer nail should be held in the boss and be placed through the top hole in the strip.

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[165, 625, 185, 642]]<|/det|>
<label>•</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[193, 625, 920, 658]]<|/det|>
The shorter nail should be placed through the bottom hole in the strip to support the slotted mass.

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[165, 670, 185, 688]]<|/det|>
<label>•</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[195, 670, 912, 688]]<|/det|>
The distance between the longer nail and the line on the strip is \(x\), as shown in Fig. 1.1.

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[193, 701, 384, 719]]<|/det|>
Measure and record \(x\).

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[554, 794, 920, 812]]<|/det|>
<form>x = ............................................................ [1]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[114, 73, 146, 92]]<|/det|>
<label>(b)</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[168, 73, 798, 92]]<|/det|>
• Pull the bottom of the strip through a short distance, as shown in Fig. 1.2.

<|ref|>image<|/ref|><|det|>[[228, 103, 767, 432]]<|/det|>


<|ref|>image_caption<|/ref|><|det|>[[463, 443, 534, 462]]<|/det|>
<label>Fig. 1.2</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[165, 473, 526, 492]]<|/det|>
• Release the strip. The strip will oscillate.

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[165, 504, 559, 523]]<|/det|>
• Determine the period \(T\) of these oscillations.

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[554, 689, 920, 708]]<|/det|>
<form>T = ............................................................ [1]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[114, 72, 144, 90]]<|/det|>
<label>(c)</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[154, 72, 920, 106]]<|/det|>
Vary \(x\) by placing the longer nail through different holes in the strip. Measure and record \(x\) and \(T\). Repeat until you have six sets of values.

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[154, 116, 757, 136]]<|/det|>
Record your results in a table. Include values of \(T^2 x\) and \(x^2\) in your table.

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[880, 490, 920, 508]]<|/det|>
<mark>[10]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[114, 520, 144, 540]]<|/det|>
<label>(d)</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[146, 520, 175, 540]]<|/det|>
<label>(i)</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[191, 520, 667, 540]]<|/det|>
Plot a graph of \(T^2 x\) on the \(y\)-axis against \(x^2\) on the \(x\)-axis.

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[890, 520, 920, 540]]<|/det|>
<mark>[3]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[149, 552, 180, 570]]<|/det|>
<label>(ii)</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[191, 552, 457, 570]]<|/det|>
Draw the straight line of best fit.

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[890, 551, 920, 570]]<|/det|>
<mark>[1]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[144, 581, 180, 600]]<|/det|>
<label>(iii)</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[191, 581, 608, 600]]<|/det|>
Determine the gradient and \(y\)-intercept of this line.

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[495, 797, 917, 817]]<|/det|>
<form>gradient = ................................................................

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[475, 829, 917, 848]]<|/det|>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[890, 846, 920, 865]]<|/det|>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[114, 74, 144, 92]]<|/det|>
<label>(c)</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[151, 74, 180, 92]]<|/det|>
<label>(i)</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[230, 73, 920, 108]]<|/det|>
Place the wooden strip on the bench so that one end of the strip overhangs the bench, as shown in Fig. 2.1.

<|ref|>image<|/ref|><|det|>[[220, 114, 796, 222]]<|/det|>


<|ref|>image_caption<|/ref|><|det|>[[463, 245, 532, 264]]<|/det|>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[191, 275, 210, 293]]<|/det|>
<label>•</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[230, 275, 920, 325]]<|/det|>
Place the chain on the wooden strip and place one of the spheres on the paper clip at the end of the chain, as shown in Fig. 2.2. The sphere must **not** touch the wooden strip.

<|ref|>image<|/ref|><|det|>[[160, 333, 836, 483]]<|/det|>


<|ref|>image_caption<|/ref|><|det|>[[463, 503, 534, 522]]<|/det|>

<label>•</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[230, 533, 920, 567]]<|/det|>
Gradually move the paper clips off the end of the wooden strip so that they hang down, as shown in Fig. 2.3.

<|ref|>image_caption<|/ref|><|det|>[[463, 682, 534, 700]]<|/det|>
